etymology.description: 小(small/young) + 妹(younger sister) = little sister; young woman (informal address)
etymology.interpretation: 小 marks youth or smallness, and 妹 specifies a younger female, yielding a younger sister. In colloquial or polite address (common in some regions), it can also refer to a young woman.

parts.english: younger sister; junior female; girl; young woman

examples.chinese: 我有一个小妹(我有一個小妹)。
那位小妹很热心(那位小妹很熱心)。
examples.english: That young lady is very helpful.

examples.chinese: 你叫小妹过来帮忙(你叫小妹過來幫忙)。
examples.english: Ask the young woman to come help.
